data.text: A workman that is a drunkard shall not become rich:
Wine and women will make men of understanding to fall away:
Moths and worms shall have him to heritage;
He that is hasty to trust is light-minded;
He that maketh merry in his heart shall be condemned: The remainder of this verse is omitted by the best authorities.
And he that hateth talk hath the less wickedness.
Never repeat what is told thee,
Whether it be of friend or foe, tell it not;
For he hath heard thee, and observed thee,
Hast thou heard a word? let it die with thee:
A fool will travail in pain with a word,
As an arrow that sticketh in the Gr. thigh of flesh.  flesh of the thigh,
Reprove a friend; it may be he did it not:
Reprove thy neighbour; it may be he said it not:
Reprove a friend; for many times there is slander:
There is one that slippeth, and not from the heart:
Reprove thy neighbour before thou threaten him;
Verses 18 and 19 are omitted by the best authorities.
All wisdom is the fear of the Lord;
The remainder of verse 20, and verse 21, are omitted by the best authorities.
And the knowledge of wickedness is not wisdom;
There is a wickedness, and the same is abomination;
Better is one that hath small understanding, and feareth,
There is an exquisite subtilty, and the same is unjust;
There is one that doeth wickedly, that hangeth down his head with mourning;
Bowing down his face, and making as if he were deaf of one ear:
And if for want of power he be hindered from sinning,
A man shall be known by his look,
